caption: Definitely a top tier pizza spot right here; their slices are always fresh & hot, with plenty of variety to chose from.  The place is very clean and well kept, the only real "con" is that the place is a bit small, but they have tables outside too.
I honestly enjoy the food and customer service, good area next to my house. The employees are always very kind. Would recommend to others.
It's just ok, not bad. Kind of overpriced for the flavor, in my opinion.

Simple place, serves canned soft drinks and bottled water, and obviously slices of pizza. I ordered Silician and Vodka, both were really good and hot. Two small tables inside, a good place to eat and rest your feet. I’d go back again!
Crust is worthy of 5 stars, vodka sauce not as much. Still have to try a regular slice, considering the price it won’t be a go to spot but definitely worth getting every once in a while
Old fashioned good pizza.

Really exceptional pizza. Got the vodka pie, pepperoni, and margherita — each one delicious. Every slice had a great light crust, crispy with a good chew, and vibrant flavors. Plenty of both old-school charm and modern sensibility — never heavy or greasy. Get some!
Very clean, quick and respectful  staff. A bit expensive but product is worth the price.
The service was awesome. Our waitress was polite and prompt and the pizza was one of the best we had in years. We both started recommending this place to our friends.
I love this place! The food is really good and reasonably priced. Their pizza is great! The atmosphere is really good gives you a nice feeling...
Just a great classic New York Slice.

Went in for a regular cheese slice in December 2020. Slice came out hot. It had good flavor and the crust was good too. I enjoyed it. My main issue is that the slice is very small. Not even the size of a typical NY slice everyone's used to. It costed $3 for a small slice. Didn't really feel I got my money's worth. Good slice but needs to be bigger.
Great neighborhood slice place. Pepperoni especially good on the sicilian
Great pizza fair prices
I am a born and raised NY-er, this is the best in the neighborhood. Favorite is vodka pie, but all are great.
Absolutely love the vodka and white pizza here!  PLEASE BRNG BACK THE WHITE PIZZA!! The lemon ricotta is so tasty.
Norm's pizza rules. Natural leavened so it's easier on the gut, high quality toppings & sauce. The vodka is out of this world. Go here now
Gave out pizza and water to voters waiting on line. You gotta love that!!
They brought us pizza to the poll at the Park Slope Armory. ❤💙💯👍🏿👍🏼👍🏻👍🏽✌
Pizza. Pizza. Absolutely legit NYC Pizza. They are a must. I went like everyday for like 4 days😍
Delicious pizza. Nice outside tables
I've never been inside there and I don't know how the pizza is but I'm pretty sure it's pretty good

Good slice of pepperoni pizza. A bit on the small side. Flavor was great. Price is reasonable. Though 1 slice isn't very satisfying, definitely the type of pizza that I put a few slices away and still be hungry.
I order three slices of pizza and the pizza was disgusting plus the pepperoni was burnt
First time trying it and it was amazing. Zesty taste with a good crunch to the crust just like I like it. Whenever I'm in the area imma def stop by again. (Dude in the Seahawks hat)
Had chicken calzone with a mango madness Snapple pizza and dishes made fresh everyday absolutely delicious
The best pepperoni pizza in the city!  Thin and crispy crust and the pepperoni was toasted nicely.  Simply delicious!
A good tasting robust pizza, crisp crust try margatita.

I just wanted to call in and order 3 slices and some knots, and the gentleman who answered the phone basically said to me " your calling for this" as if it was a bother, #1 I did not have luxury of waiting there because when i go there the worker are most interested in the females walk in there half plastered and take forever to get 2 slices ready, so i figured i would call and preorder, but just the interaction over the phone will make me not ever give them my bussiness, what a shame. Lost customer here.
Tasty and fast
Great slice of NYC style pizza and square slices
So dang good! The Sicilian is such fire. It’s my go-to pizza in Brooklyn seriously
Good food!
It was my first visit there; the pizza was salty and the crust was dry and not much of a crust.
A true New York slice. Quickly becoming my favorite slice joint. The sourdough crust is perfectly crisp and chewy. All the ingredients are  top notch. Try every slice!
Solid place for a slice in a crowded pizza market. Always get a pepperoni when I'm in the area .
Place is garbage.
Great slices of pizza!
They threw out and didn’t serve quite a few police officers last night. Not cool. It’s a no for me.
Terrible place.
Worst pizza ever.  Dirty filthy restaurant and employees smell like they haven’t showered in days.
Have had better.
Bad service , the service is based on  yours looks and colors.
username: DI NO A LAS HEREJIAS EL REMANENTE

caption: Found hair in my pizza! And wouldn't think about going back!
I didn't like the pizza. What else one can say? The dough was too thin. They should be more generous with cheese.
Not the best. Very distasteful people and pizza. Call the ghostbusters.
Too small, limited menu and NO GARLIC POWDER? What pizza shop has no garlic? The owner wasn’t too concerned either. No good customer service.
Baby Nyc slice it’s okay
Great
Perfect NYC pizza. Had a full pepperoni pie for takeout for $28 and it was enough for 4 people. Very tasty, will be back!
Better than i expected. The square slice has airy crispy dough which is nice for a change. The white slice has good cheese on it.
best slice in downtown bk

Here is my take, the pizza is not bad, the guys in the back are courteous however here is where I get lost; there is no Garlic Powder!? How is this possible!? I asked and was told the sauce and the cheese are flavored with garlic; however he had no real good answer when I asked “what if the customer wants more garlic flavor?” His response as he looked at me with a smile: “ we talked to the boss about this because all the customers say the same thing!”  My advice...give the customer the option by having those options available so the customer remains satisfied; don’t dictate to the customer, the customer wants and needs is what keeps them returning so please make it happen, have garlic powder available because that’s what every decent pizza shop has, so for that I give it 2 stars because it’s such a simple ask!!!
Great spot and the crew is funny

Incredible New York pizza. Quintessential place to get pizza in Brooklyn! I suggest  a tour of the transit museum, build up an appetite and then walk over to Norm’s after for a perfect slice. Great customer service! The guys were so kind and helpful! Decided to take a pie home - don’t miss this gem!

Great pizza. Few options, but they are all tasty. The dough is on point, and the aroma of the pizza just pulls you into the shop as you pass by it! The staff is also polite and very nice. It's a small cozy shop with few rudimentary seating, but it has a nice feel to it nonetheless.
Great pizza
username: El deciado de las naciones Cristo

caption: Fantastic old school NYC pizza.

This feels like a place aiming for the perfection of the form of NY style pizza.  The crust is light, chewy and tasty, with just the right amount of cheese.  The people working there are friendly and knowledgeable - in just the few minutes I was there, saw them greet everyone and comment on the types of pizza and the ingredients.  Just don’t go expecting to sit and eat - the place is tiny with maybe enough room for 6-7 people sitting and standing.  The comparison to other places is also helped by the fact that the nearest pizza places are 2 99-cent shops and a Papa John’s.
seems like theyre taking tips from their delivery people
Wow, definitely the best pizza off Fulton no question.
Great pizza. A nice addition to downtown.

Authentic New York Pizza is hands down the best in the world, and Norm's is no exception. The staff was very helpful and patient with this tourist. Had the cheese and the classic Margherita pizza. Amazing!
Best slice in Downtown BK, hands down. If only the tourists knew the line wasn’t worth the wait in DUMBO
The slices here might be the perfect NY slices. Noam (Norm) has perfected the art of crust, sauce, and cheese. I've lived in NY for 13 years and this is probably the best pizza I've ever had.
Pizza was good tasting

Great slices. Staff is friendly . Pizza is great and the pepperoni is amazing. Definitely worth every penny. Don't waste your time or money at those 99cent shops. Would post a pic but you wouldn't want to see an empty plate. Thanks guys.
Great pizza...maybe a bit pricey but well worth it to me.
Top contender for best slice in NYC
The pizza was tasty and it had a nice crispy crust.
Best pizza

Great NY Pizza. Stumbled onto this place by chance and glad I stopped in. The pizza was tasty with a nice crispy crust. Good variety of pizza. Staff was very friendly and welcoming to everyone that came in. A few seats to eat in house, but to go seemed to be the popular option. Recommend stopping by.
Great new slice shop!
Good pizza, great dough. Small to eat in.
First time I been here and the pizza is not just any normal pizza.  Has different flavors to it and Their pizza is very good / delicious.
Best slices in NYC. Not even close.
Pepperoni 🍕

Good crust, a generous helping of pepperoni, and fast takeout service.  I stopped by Norm’s today on a whim. I ordered a slice of pepperoni pizza and was surprised, but also not surprised that the slice was four bucks. I like that they use the smaller pepperonis and they have that slightly burnt taste around the edges. Fortina also serves this type of pepperoni on their pizza.  Rents in Downtown Brooklyn (and pretty much everywhere else in NYC) are sky high, but I don’t know how long they’ll be able to compete with the “dollar slice” joints a few blocks away.  I’ll return to Norm’s to see what really separates them from the norm.
Really great, neighborhood slice joint.

First spot I stopped into after arriving in Brooklyn NY for the first time.  Couldn’t of had a better experience. Gio, the man working the front was awesome. Friendly and very welcoming!  Awesome za, classic NY style....this is coming from a guy who lives in the Chicago area.  Will be back!
Pizza is fantastic a must try when in area
I had the cheese slice. I found the taste a little on the salty side. Excellent crust by the way. Worth a second visit. Place is miniscule.
Great pizza, fast service. A tad expensive, but not unreasonable.
Really, really good pizza, and this is coming from an Italian. Very nice staff as well.
Best NY-style slice joint west of BedStuy & north of  Red Hook. Vodka sauce pie is amazing.
Excellent slices. Lots of flavor and perfectly crispy crust
Nice New York slice with the right amount of toppings, delicious! They play a nice selection on rock music here and the place is very clean.
It's messed up how good this pizza is. Also they were playing punk music so it was a thoroughly delicious visit
Really good pizza by the slice!
This is a great place for a quick slice of pizza. The slices are generously sized, tasty and at a great price.
Classic slice, not too much sauce, quality ingredients, and great tasting crust too
Fantastic. A well-needed slice shop in Downtown Brooklyn. Pricy but absolutely worth it.
Perfect margherita slice
Great white pizza.  The people here are great , excellent pizza.

Best slice in Downtown Brooklyn! It’s not even close. Finally a great slice in Download Brooklyn. I stopped by for a pepperoni slice and absolutely loved it. Fantastic crust, delicious sauce, and the perfect amount of toppings. This will quickly become a go to spot for me. Give Norm’s Pizza and try and I’m sure you will agree!
A great slice. Maybe one of the best. I would love to give it a 5 but they seem to never have the square slice features in the New York Times article. And that square slice sounds delicious...
Best slice shop in the area. I like the slightly burnt crust.

I've been to this location two times. They take cards even for a slice!  The first time I tried the cheese pizza.  The cheese was fresh, and the slice was crisp. It was an average slice.  The second time I tried the Margherita Pizza. This is the slice to try! The crispiness of the slice is delicately balanced with the mozzarella and sauce. It creates a delicious taste with each bite! After this experience I think this is the pizza place to go to for specialty slices not for a plain cheese pizza.  The actual space is tiny and can be a bit of a hassle to navigate if there are more than six people there.  The staff is friendly, however, I wish they would direct traffic more as people tend to wait in the front even after they ordered, which can create an unnecessary log jam. Also this creates a situation where they put out a slice and there could be someone hovering above your food, I personally find that be an unideal experience as I do not want someone's hand over my slice of Pizza.
Just had the margarita pizza, and it was fantastic!!
Great thin crust.  Dough and sauce little sour.  Wish there were more cheese.  $3 for plain slice is a little steep when I can get 3 slices at 99 cent pizza joints around the neighborhood.
Pizza is off the charts!!!!!  Definitely one of my favorite slices in Brooklyn!!!!
